medical_history.chief_complaint: Referral for genetic counseling due to positive first trimester screen with increased NT thickness.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms were identified at 13 weeks of gestation during a first trimester screen which was positive for trisomy 21 and 18. The fetal NT measured 6.44 mm. An anatomy ultrasound at 20 weeks showed early onset growth restriction with multiple anomalies.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a past medical history of hypertension on labetalol and low-dose daily aspirin for preeclampsia prevention. She has a history of an uncomplicated first trimester pregnancy loss.
